com.esri.mo2.map.img
Class BaseImageLayerSource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayerSource
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.img.BaseImageLayerSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageLayerSource, LayerSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageServer
Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.

public abstract class BaseImageLayerSource
extends BaseLayerSource
implements ImageLayerSource

Defines a basic implementation of ImageLayerSource. It provides support for all of the Layer handling, including management of a BaseImageServerLayer and a BaseImageServer. Subclasses must implement the refresh() method which is expected to create and set the properties of sub-Layers using the createXXXXLayer() methods.

reconstructLayer

public void reconstructLayer(SubLayerSnapshot snapshot)
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: ImageLayerSource
for convenience, you can reconstruct the subLayers of an ImageServerLayer using the given SubLayerSnapshot. This might be necessary for ImageLayerSources that can change the subLayers at any time, perhaps because of some scale dependency-relatonship. The ImageServerLayer associated with the SubLayerSnapshot will be modified.

Specified by:
reconstructLayer in interface ImageLayerSource
Parameters:
snapshot - the SubLayerSnapshot
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the snapshot is null, its associated Layer is null, or if the layer's LayerSource is not the same as this ImageLayerSource
See Also:
ImageLayerSource.reconstructLayer(com.esri.mo2.map.img.SubLayerSnapshot)

populateGroupLayer

public void populateGroupLayer(ImageServerLayer group)
Deprecated. 
Populates the ImageServerLayer. All sub-Layers are constructed and added in the same order that they were first added via addLayerInfo(). Subclasses can override and modify the result of this method.

Parameters:
group - the Layer to be populated

Returns:
a new BaseImageServerLayer

applyDefaultExtent

protected void applyDefaultExtent(Envelope extent)
                           throws MissingSubLayersException
Deprecated. 
An utility provided for LayerSources to update Layers for which a null extent was initially set. This is typically needed in situations where only the ImageServer's FullExtent is known at the end of an initialisation run through, via the refresh() method.

Parameters:
extent - the extent to be applied to all datasets that don't already have one
Throws:
MissingSubLayersException - if no subLayers have yet been defined
